summary: Arthur G. Vaivada was a CIA agent who also used the alias Ross L. Crozier. He requested reassignment from Cuba in June 1958, as documented in a dispatch from the Chief of Station in Habana. Documents related to Vaivada (as Crozier) include biographical information, agent evaluations, receipts, and file requests, particularly concerning Project HUMANOID in Costa Rica. He was involved in various CIA operations, and his file contains information about contract extensions, operational clearance requests, and suitability for contact agent work. The documents span from 1952 to 1975, indicating a long period of involvement with the CIA.
key_connections: Chief of the Western Hemisphere Division (WHD)
significance: While the documents detail Vaivada's CIA activities and alias, there is no direct mention of the JFK assassination. His significance lies in his role as a CIA agent involved in operations in Cuba and Costa Rica during the Cold War era, potentially relevant to understanding the broader context of CIA activities during that period.
